definitions.example: All participants must adhere to the rules.

definitions.definition: A ruler; device for measuring, a straightedge, a measure.
A straight line (continuous mark, as made by a pen or the like), especially one lying across a paper as a guide for writing.
The act of ruling; administration of law; government; empire; authority; control.
A normal condition or state of affairs.
definitions.example: As a rule, our senior editors are serious-minded.

definitions.definition: An order regulating the practice of the courts, or an order made between parties to an action or a suit.
A determinate method prescribed for performing any operation and producing a certain result.
definitions.example: a rule for extracting the cube root

definitions.definition: A thin plate of brass or other metal, of the same height as the type, and used for printing lines, as between columns on the same page, or in tabular work.
To regulate, be in charge of, make decisions for, reign over.
To mark (paper or the like) with rules (lines).
To establish or settle by, or as by, a rule; to fix by universal or general consent, or by common practice.
